overview_of_class:
The course is a workshop in the development of a new performance piece.
Three years ago, MFA director Michael Cotey began an adaptation of Station Eleven, the award-winning 2014 novel by Emily St. John Mandel. The apocalyptic novel tells the story of neo-tribal life in the former United States after a pandemic flu has wiped out most of the world's population. Paul Edwards has been Michael's faculty mentor on the project, and will supervise the development of Michael's workshop staging for this fall's "Presentational Aesthetics" class.

ENROLLMENT. Approx. 10.
E-mail request for permission directly to instructor, during SoC pre-registration, at: or .
Please indicate whether you wish to work on the project as "actor" or "designer."

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Contract grading, outcome-based evaluation. Quarter-long group performances. Short written responses to readings and in-class performance work. Attendance is mandatory.
